g.title: IMDB_movie_connections
g.text: This graph shows references between movies, the node size indicates the rank.
Click on a film to see the references on IMDB.
bold titles = IMDB Top 250, grey = TV series.

a.xlink:title: D: Erich von Stroheim, rank 88 (IMDB: 8.1) "The sudden fortune won from a lottery fans such destructive greed that it ruins the lives of the three people involved."
D: James W. Horne, rank 81 (IMDB: 7.2) "To reconcile with his girlfriend, a bookish college student tries to become an athlete."
D: Luis BuÃ±uel, rank 62 (IMDB: 8.0) "In a dream-like sequence, a woman's eye is slit open--juxtaposed with a similarly shaped cloud obsucuring..."
D: Edward F. Cline, rank 72 (IMDB: 8.0) "Farmhands Keaton and Roberts share a cottage full of mechanical devices for making life easy. They are rivals for the farmer's daughter..."

D: Fritz Lang, rank 6 (IMDB: 8.4 #95) "In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences."
D: Giovanni Pastrone, rank 3 (IMDB: 6.6) "Three centuries before Christus. Young Cabiria is kidnapped by some pirates during one eruption of the Etna..."
D: Sergei M. Eisenstein, rank 28 (IMDB: 8.1) "A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resulting street demonstration which brought on a police massacre."
D: F.W. Murnau, rank 56 (IMDB: 8.1) "Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife. Silent classic based on the story "Dracula.""

g.title: Nosferatu, eine Symphonie des Grauens (1922)->The Scarecrow (1920)

a.xlink:title: D: Clyde Bruckman, rank 47 (IMDB: 8.4 #120) "When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single handedly and straight through enemy lines."
D: Harry O. Hoyt, rank 30 (IMDB: 7.1) "The first film adaptation of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's classic novel about a land where prehistoric creatures still roam."

g.title: Chang: A Drama of the Wilderness (1927)

a.xlink:title: D: Merian C. Cooper, rank 23 (IMDB: 7.4) "Elephants disrupt the lives of a family deep in the jungles of Northern Siam, and an entire village."
a.text: Chang: A Drama of the Wilderness (1927)

a.xlink:title: D: Larry Semon, rank 37 (IMDB: 5.3) "A Toymaker tells a bizarre story about how the Land of Oz was ruled by Prince Kynd, but he was overthrown by Prime Minister Kruel..."

g.title: His Majesty, the Scarecrow of Oz (1914)

a.xlink:title: D: L. Frank Baum, rank 50 (IMDB: 6.0) "A wicked king has taken over the Emerald City, and wants his daughter, Princess Gloria to marry the horrid courtier Googly-Goo..."
a.text: His Majesty, the Scarecrow of Oz (1914)

g.title: The Wizard of Oz (1925)->His Majesty, the Scarecrow of Oz (1914)

a.xlink:title: D: Charles Chaplin, rank 90 (IMDB: 7.9) "The Tramp finds work and the girl of his dreams at a circus."
D: James Cameron, rank 92 (IMDB: 8.5 #42) "The cyborg who once tried to kill Sarah Connor must now protect her teenage son, John Connor, from an even more powerful and advanced Terminator."
D: Victor Fleming, rank 1 (IMDB: 8.3 #121) "Dorothy Gale is swept away to a magical land in a tornado and embarks on a quest to see the Wizard who can help her return home."

g.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)->The Wizard of Oz (1939)

a.xlink:title: D: James Cameron, rank 86 (IMDB: 8.5 #60) "The planet from Â (1979) has been colonized, but contact is lost. This time, the rescue team has impressive firepower, but will it be enough?"
D: James Cameron, rank 82 (IMDB: 7.4) "Fictional romantic tale of a rich girl and poor boy who meet on the ill-fated voyage of the 'unsinkable' ship."

g.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)

a.xlink:title: D: Stanley Kubrick, rank 58 (IMDB: 8.6 #33) "An insane general starts a process to nuclear holocaust that a war room of politicians and generals frantically try to stop."
a.text: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)

g.title: Titanic (1997)->Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)

a.xlink:title: D: Stanley Kubrick, rank 10 (IMDB: 8.4 #86) "Mankind finds a mysterious, obviously artificial, artifact buried on the moon and, with the intelligent computer HAL, sets off on a quest."
D: Quentin Tarantino, rank 84 (IMDB: 9.0 #5) "The lives of two mob hit men, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption."
D: Joseph Barbera, rank 65 (IMDB: 8.0) "The misadventures of a modern stone-age family and friends."

g.title: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)

a.xlink:title: D: Sergio Leone, rank 43 (IMDB: 9.0 #4) "A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery."
a.text: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)

g.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)->Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)

a.xlink:title: D: Mike Nichols, rank 94 (IMDB: 8.2 #159) "Recent college graduate Benjamin Braddock is trapped into an affair with Mrs. Robinson, who happens to be the wife of his father's business partner and then finds himself falling in love with her teenage daughter, Elaine."

D: Alfred Hitchcock, rank 4 (IMDB: 8.7 #24) "A young woman steals $40,000 from her employer's client, and subsequently encounters a young motel proprietor too long under the domination of his mother."
D: Tobe Hooper, rank 73 (IMDB: 7.5) "Five friends visiting their grandpa's old house are hunted down and terrorized by a chainsaw wielding killer and his family of grave-robbing cannibals."

g.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)->The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)

a.xlink:title: D: John G. Avildsen, rank 60 (IMDB: 8.1 #215) "A small time boxer gets a once in a lifetime chance to fight the heavyweight champ in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect."

D: Martin Scorsese, rank 42 (IMDB: 8.6 #41) "A mentally unstable Vietnam war veteran works as nighttime taxi driver in a city whose perceived decadence and sleaze feeds his urge to violently lash out, attempting to save a teenage prostitute in the process."

D: John Boorman, rank 70 (IMDB: 7.9) "Intent on seeing the Cahulawassee River before it's turned into one huge lake, outdoor fanatic Lewis Medlock takes his friends on a river-rafting trip they'll never forget into the dangerous American back-country."

D: Francis Ford Coppola, rank 16 (IMDB: 8.6 #37) "During the on-going Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade Green Beret who has set himself up as a God among a local tribe."
D: Frank Capra, rank 75 (IMDB: 8.7 #29) "An angel helps a compassionate but despairingly frustrated businessman by showing what life would have been like if he never existed."
D: Edwin S. Porter, rank 52 (IMDB: 7.5) "A group of bandits stage a brazen train hold-up, only to find a determined posse hot on their heels."
D: Elia Kazan, rank 46 (IMDB: 8.4 #104) "An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses."
D: Andy Wachowski, rank 96 (IMDB: 8.7 #26) "A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers."
D: George Lucas, rank 2 (IMDB: 8.8 #14) "Luke Skywalker leaves his home planet, teams up with other rebels, and tries to save Princess Leia from the evil clutches of Darth Vader."
D: Jonathan Demme, rank 89 (IMDB: 8.7 #27) "A young FBI cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims."

g.title: The Silence of the Lambs (1991)->Un chien andalou (1929)
The Silence of the Lambs (1991)->2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)

a.xlink:title: D: Tod Browning, rank 63 (IMDB: 7.7) "The ancient vampire Count Dracula arrives in England and begins to prey upon the virtuous young Mina."

g.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)->Metropolis (1927)

a.xlink:title: D: Terence Young, rank 21 (IMDB: 7.3) "James Bond's investigation of a missing colleague in Jamaica leads him to the island of the mysterious Dr. No and a scheme to end the US space program."

g.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)->Dr. No (1962)

a.xlink:title: D: Merian C. Cooper, rank 5 (IMDB: 8.0 #244) "A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal giant gorilla who takes a shine to their female blonde star."

g.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)->King Kong (1933)

a.xlink:title: D: George A. Romero, rank 36 (IMDB: 8.0) "A group of people hide from bloodthirsty zombies in a farmhouse."

D: Alfred Hitchcock, rank 80 (IMDB: 7.9) "A wealthy San Francisco socialite pursues a potential boyfriend to a small Northern California town that slowly takes a turn for the bizarre when birds of all kinds suddenly begin to attack people there in increasing numbers and with increasing viciousness."

g.title: Night of the Living Dead (1968)->The Birds (1963)
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang (1932)

a.xlink:title: D: Mervyn LeRoy, rank 68 (IMDB: 8.1) "Wrongly convicted James Allen serves in the intolerable conditions of a southern chain gang, which later comes back to haunt him."
a.text: I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang (1932)

g.title: Dr. No (1962)->I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang (1932)

a.xlink:title: D: Guy Hamilton, rank 53 (IMDB: 7.9) "Investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve."

D: Roman Polanski, rank 27 (IMDB: 8.1 #225) "A young couple move into a new apartment, only to be surrounded by peculiar neighbors and occurrences. When the wife becomes mysteriously pregnant, paranoia over the safety of her unborn child begins controlling her life."
D: Marc Daniels, rank 7 (IMDB: 8.6) "Capt. Kirk and the crew of the Starship Enterprise explore space and defend the United Federation of Planets."
D: David Lean, rank 99 (IMDB: 8.5 #48) "Epic rumination on a flamboyant and controversial British military figure and his conflicted loyalties during wartime service."
D: John Ford, rank 19 (IMDB: 8.1) "As a Civil War veteran spends years searching for a young niece captured by Indians, his motivation becomes increasingly questionable."
D: Alfred Hitchcock, rank 13 (IMDB: 8.1) "A young woman discovers her visiting "Uncle Charlie" may not be the man he seems to be."

g.title: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)->Greed (1924)
Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)->The General (1926)
The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)

a.xlink:title: D: David Lean, rank 74 (IMDB: 8.4 #79) "After settling his differences with a Japanese PoW camp commander, a British colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors - while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it."
a.text: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)

g.title: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)->The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)

a.xlink:title: D: Lisa Simon, rank 33 (IMDB: 8.5) "On a special inner city street, the inhabitants, both human and puppet, teach preschool subjects with comedy, cartoons, games and songs."
D: Orson Welles, rank 22 (IMDB: 8.3 #122) "Stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in Mexican border town."
D: James Whale, rank 32 (IMDB: 8.0) "Horror classic in which an obsessed scientist assembles a living being from parts of exhumed corpses."

g.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)->The Wizard of Oz (1925)
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)

a.xlink:title: D: William Cottrell, rank 9 (IMDB: 7.9) "Snow White, pursued by a jealous queen, hides with the Dwarfs; the queen feeds her a poison apple, but Prince Charming awakens her with a kiss."
a.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)

g.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)->Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)

a.xlink:title: D: James Parrott, rank 41 (IMDB: 4.6) "Thelma and Patsy find themselves in a spooky house inhabited by a nut who is a mechanical genius and has made a robot who does everything..."

g.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)->The Tin Man (1935)

a.xlink:title: D: Maurice Tourneur, rank 40 (IMDB: 6.9) "Gwen's family is rich, but her parents ignore her and most of the servants push her around, so she is lonely and unhappy..."

g.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)->The Poor Little Rich Girl (1917)

a.xlink:title: D: John Ford, rank 67 (IMDB: 7.0) "A dozen British soldiers, lost in a Mesopotamian desert during world war I, are menaced by unseen Arab enemies."
D: Ernst Lubitsch, rank 18 (IMDB: 7.6) "The small kingdom of Marshovia has a little problem. The main tax-payer, the wealthy widow Sonia (who..."
D: J. Searle Dawley, rank 15 (IMDB: 6.4) "Snow White, a beautiful girl, is despised by a wicked queen who tries to destroy her. With the aid of dwarves in the woods..."

g.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)->Snow White (1916/I)

a.xlink:title: D: Jean Renoir, rank 34 (IMDB: 8.2) "During the First World War, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German POW camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are sent to a seemingly impenetrable fortress which seems impossible to escape from."

D: Victor Fleming, rank 17 (IMDB: 8.2 #151) "American classic in which a manipulative woman and a roguish man carry on a turbulent love affair in the American south during the Civil War and Reconstruction."
D: D.W. Griffith, rank 12 (IMDB: 7.1) "The Civil War divides friends and destroys families, but that's nothing compared to the anarchy in the black-ruled South after the war."

g.title: Gone with the Wind (1939)->The Birth of a Nation (1915)

a.xlink:title: D: W.S. Van Dyke, rank 49 (IMDB: 7.1) "A trader and his daughter set off in search of the fabled graveyard of the elephants in deepest Africa, only to encounter a wild man raised by apes."

g.title: King Kong (1933)->Chang: A Drama of the Wilderness (1927)

a.xlink:title: D: John Cromwell, rank 87 (IMDB: 7.0) "Beautiful Gaby meets a romantic jewel thief in the mysterious Casbah."

g.title: Taxi Driver (1976)->The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)

a.xlink:title: D: Don Siegel, rank 77 (IMDB: 7.9) "A San Francisco cop with little regard for rules (but who always gets results) tries to track down a serial killer who snipes at random victims."
D: Francis Ford Coppola, rank 11 (IMDB: 9.2 #2) "The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son."
D: George Lucas, rank 38 (IMDB: 6.8) "Set in the 25th century, the story centers around a man and a woman who rebel against their rigidly controlled society."

g.title: Star Wars (1977)->Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo. (1966)

a.xlink:title: D: Ridley Scott, rank 55 (IMDB: 8.5 #46) "A mining ship, investigating a suspected SOS, lands on a distant planet. The crew discovers some strange creatures and investigates."

D: Steven Spielberg, rank 14 (IMDB: 8.3 #112) "When a gigantic great white shark begins to menace the small island community of Amity, a police chief, a marine scientist and grizzled fisherman set out to stop it."
D: Stanley Donen, rank 45 (IMDB: 8.4 #77) "A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound."

D: Alfred Hitchcock, rank 20 (IMDB: 8.6 #44) "A San Francisco detective suffering from acrophobia investigates the strange activities of an old friend's wife, all the while becoming dangerously obsessed with her."

D: Stanley Kubrick, rank 31 (IMDB: 8.5 #52) "In future Britain, charismatic delinquent Alex DeLarge is jailed and volunteers for an experimental aversion therapy developed by the government in an effort to solve society's crime problem... but not all goes to plan."

D: JosÃ© DÃ­az Morales, rank 97 Â
D: Orson Welles, rank 25 (IMDB: 8.6 #36) "Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance."

D: Alfred Hitchcock, rank 71 (IMDB: 8.4 #107) "When a naive young woman marries a rich widower and settles in his gigantic mansion, she finds the memory of the first wife maintaining a grip on her husband and the servants."

a.xlink:title: D: D.W. Griffith, rank 44 (IMDB: 6.6) "Drunken red Indians carouse in pagan revelry, whipping up their appetite for dog meat. In search of supper..."

g.title: The Birth of a Nation (1915)->The Battle at Elderbush Gulch (1913)

a.xlink:title: D: Henry Lehrman, rank 95 (IMDB: 5.5) "At a farm near Bangville, the young daughter see strangers in the barn. She quickly rushes to the house and calls the police. The police engage in a haphazard rush across the countryside to get there in time."
D: Steven Spielberg, rank 39 (IMDB: 7.9) "A group of Earth children help a stranded alien botanist return home."

g.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial (1982)->Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)

a.xlink:title: D: John Brahm, rank 51 (IMDB: 9.5) "Rod Serling's seminal anthology series focused on ordinary folks who suddenly found themselves in extraordinary, usually supernatural, situations. The stories would typically end with an ironic twist that would see the guilty punished."

g.title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)->THX 1138 (1971)

a.xlink:title: D: Brian De Palma, rank 59 (IMDB: 8.2 #157) "In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug empire while succumbing to greed. (Cartel not Mafia)"

D: Stanley Kubrick, rank 57 (IMDB: 8.5 #49) "A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil and spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from the past and of the future."

a.xlink:title: D: Steven Soderbergh, rank 76 (IMDB: 7.1) "A sexually repressed woman's husband is having an affair with her sister. The arrival of a visitor with a rather unusual fetish changes everything."
